intro: Mibora verna subsp. desvauxii, commonly known as the yellow mibora, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
